subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Any one can help me?Question
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
Cabinets that are designed for sound reinforcement, better bass response,
and amplifiers that have better frequency response. Larger pseakers.

 F-S

> > > > > > > > > > > <purplealiengirl@> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > I make the triangle sweep adjustable so I can cover
> the
> > > > > entire AM
> > > > > > > or
> > > > > > > > > FM
> > > > > > > > > > > > band. Some tuners have different sweep requirements
> for
> > > each
> > > > > > > band, so
> > > > > > > > > > > > sometimes have to add a pot to adjust the max level
> for
> > > one
> > > > > of
> > > > > > > the
> > > > > > > > > bands.
> > > > > > > > > > > > AM=530 to 1710 Khz and FM 88.5 to 108mhz, but you
> don't
> > > have
> > > > > to
> > > > > > > cover
> > > > > > > > > the
> > > > > > > > > > > > entire band, all that is required is enough to
> provide
> > > the
> > > > > raw
> > > > > > > audio
> > > > > > > > > bits
> > > > > > > > > > > > the entities use to make their voices.
> > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > A Danish researcher back in the 80s was just
> "wobbling"
> > > > > between a
> > > > > > > > > couple
> > > > > > > > > > > > stations to make contact. His name was Stein and
> there's
> > > more
> > > > > > > info on
> > > > > > > > > the
> > > > > > > > > > > > German VTF site. Stein also has his sweep circuit
> there.
> > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > The best sounding systems seem to be the way Steve
> Hultay
> > > > > makes
> > > > > > > his,
> > > > > > > > > by
> > > > > > > > > > > > adding sweep to a complete radio. see
> > > keyportparanormal.com.
> > > > > I
> > > > > > > take
> > > > > > > > > the
> > > > > > > > > > > > tuners out of the radio, and supply my own amplifier
> and
> > > > > sweep.
> > > > > > > At
> > > > > > > > > > > present
> > > > > > > > > > > > I'm making a box using a Timex clock radio tuner, the
> > > > > triangle
> > > > > > > sweep,
> > > > > > > > > and
> > > > > > > > > > > > computer sound amplifier and speaker system for the
> bass
> > > > > > > response. I
> > > > > > > > > just
> > > > > > > > > > > > started this project yesterday. I use Timex model
> T309T
> > > > > > > AM/FM/nature
> > > > > > > > > > > sounds
> > > > > > > > > > > > clock radios when I can find them in thrift stores
> cheap.
> > > I
> > > > > found
> > > > > > > a
> > > > > > > > > Timex
> > > > > > > > > > > > model T313T this morning, and hoping it has the
> seperate
> > > > > tuner
> > > > > > > board
> > > > > > > > > > > inside,
> > > > > > > > > > > > as the 300 series has so far.
> > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > I used to use car stereo tuner modules, but those
> tend to
> > > be
> > > > > too
> > > > > > > > > noisy.
> > > > > > > > > > > Box
> > > > > > > > > > > > 13, that Hultay just got back is based on a car
> tuner. He
> > > did
> > > > > a
> > > > > > > > > YouTube
> > > > > > > > > > > > video of it.
> > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > I'm still pretty much an amateur at this, there are
> so
> > > many
> > > > > > > > > variables.
